intro: Gaudichaudia cynanchoides var. isandra, commonly known as the golden beard veldt, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and showy yellow-orange flowers. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy surface, and its stems are often covered in fine pubescence. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained, sandy soils. The flowers bloom in spring and summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
